title: Completed PE Summary - fv Lisa Leanne
raw_html:
Category Fishing
Registered Owner & Manager: Details
Port of registry: Plymouth
Flag: UK
Type: Dredger
Built: 1999
Length overall: 9.6
Gross tonnage: 9.76
Date & Time 10/12/05 10:12
Location of incident: Plymouth harbour area
Incident Type: Fire/Explosion
Persons onboard: 2 crew
Injuries/ fatalities: 1 fatality
Damage/ Pollution: Minor Damage

Synopsis

A crewman died onboard the fishing vessel Lisa Leanne, whilst it was moored alongside. He had returned to the vessel in the early hours of the morning to sleep onboard, and was smoking a last cigarette in the accommodation space, when he fell asleep or unconscious and his cigarette started a smouldering fire. The crewman died of smoke inhalation without regaining consciousness.

Action taken:

The Chief Inspector has written to the owners of the Lisa Leanne highlighting the benefits of fitting a simple smoke alarm and employing fire resistant materials for upholstery and coverings.
